ygData.subject: Guys and dolls
ygData.msgSnippet: Hail all! Well, I had a good chuckle reading the post about blondes and brunettes in EQ. Guys are just too silly aren t they? They see a blonde graphic and
ygData.messageBody:
Hail all!
Well, I had a good chuckle reading the post about blondes and brunettes in
EQ. Guys are just too silly aren't they? They see a blonde graphic and start
to follow it around, but won't do the same for a brunette graphic? No wonder
they fall for silicone breasts and bleach blondes in real life! :)
As I play a dwarf I have a less "seductive" look in-game, something I share
with other short people like gnomes and halflings (and of course ogres and
trolls :) I guess the programmers like the long legged half nudes, but kept
us short and stumpy folk in more sensible knee socks and heftier underwear.
I personally think a lot of the female clothing looks beautiful (wood elf
banded is one of my favourites), but I do understand the comments about it
looking rather trampy and downright hard to wear in battle. It would be nice
if there was an option to have your outfit either revealing or not so
revealing. Like a roleplay switch sort of :) Then the female casters could
choose a bustier look, and the warriors could (if they so wished) choose to
cover themselves a bit more.
Anyway, I hope this clothing issue doesn't discourage too many players. Male
hormones must not be allowed to destroy our gaming experience!

Maria, aka Disa, dwarven cleric on Tunare
